snippet: The national police chief was the first top official to explicitly attribute the attack to members of the aggrieved minority in western China.
abstract: Thai officials blame Uighur militants for Bangkok bombing that killed 20 people, most of them Chinese tourists; have arrested suspects including Chinese national and several Turks, saying attack was in retaliation for government's widely-criticized forced repatriation of Uighurs; would be first known terrorist attack by Uighurs outside China.

byline.original: By THOMAS FULLER and EDWARD WONG
byline.contributor: Thomas Fuller reported from Bangkok, and Edward Wong from Beijing. Poypiti Amatatham contributed reporting from Bangkok, and Ceylan Yeginsu from Istanbul.

lead_paragraph: The national police chief was the first top official to explicitly attribute the attack to members of the aggrieved minority in western China.

headline.main: Thailand Blames Uighur Militants for Bombing at Bangkok Shrine
headline.print_headline: Thailand Blames Uighur Extremists for Fatal Bomb Blast at Bangkok Shrine
